text: Estradiol/nomegestrol acetate (E2/NOMAC), sold under the brand names Naemis and Zoely among others, is a fixed-dose combination product of estradiol, an estrogen, and nomegestrol acetate, a progestogen, which is used in menopausal hormone therapy in and as a birth control pill to prevent pregnancy in women. It is taken by mouth. == See also == * Estradiol valerate/dienogest * Estradiol valerate/cyproterone acetate * List of combined sex-hormonal preparations == References == == External links == * * Category:Combined estrogen–progestogen formulations
title: Estradiol/nomegestrol acetate
